clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Remote Ischaemic Preconditioning on Renal Function in Patients Undergoing Living Donor Kidney Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Lower Limb Ischaemic Preconditioning on Renal Function in Patients Undergoing Living Donor Kidney Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate whether lower limb ischaemic preconditioning can improve renal function in patients undergoing living donor kidney transplantation

detailed_description.textblock: Ischemia reperfusion injury (IRI) induced renal failure after kidney transplantation is a common clinical problem associated with a high morbidity and mortality. To reduce the adverse effects of IRI after organ transplantation various strategies aimed at the different pathophysiological processes of IRI have been investigated. Remote ischemic preconditioning (RIPC) is one such strategy where brief IRI of one organ protects other organs from sustained IRI. Many studies have shown that RIPC protects heart, muscle flaps, stomach, liver, lungs, and kidneys from IRI. RIPC of the limb with a tourniquet is a safe and convenient method of preconditioning organs against IRI. However, the efficacy of RIPC in patients undergoing living donor kidney transplantation need to be established and mechanism of early and late RIPC, such as whether the donor should undergo remote preconditioning or the recipient, need to be investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma Creatine Concentration of the Recipients
primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 3days after the operation
primary_outcome.description: Plasma creatinine concentration before surgery, 1hour, 4hours, 24hours, 48hours and 72hours after the artery unclamping

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary Output of the Recipients Postoperatively
primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 3days after the operation
primary_outcome.description: Accumulated urinary output 1hour, 4hours and 24hours after the artery unclamping and the urinary output on the 2nd and 3rd day after the operation

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of NGAL in the Recipients
primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24hours after the operation
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin (NGAL) before the operation and 24hours after the artery unclamping

secondary_outcome.description: Delayed Graft Function according to the clinical symptoms
time from the day of operation to the day of discharge for the recipients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the admission to the discharge of the patients
secondary_outcome.description: Total costs from the admission to the discharge of the recipients

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine Concentration of NAG Preoperatively in Recipients
secondary_outcome.description: Urine concentration of N-acetyl-D-glucosaminidase (NAG) before the operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine Concentration of NAG Postoperatively in Recipients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24hours after the artery unclamping
secondary_outcome.description: Urine concentration of N-acetyl-D-glucosaminidase (NAG) 1hour, 4hours and 24hours after the artery unclamping in the recipients

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine Concentration of RBP Preoperatively in the Recipients
secondary_outcome.description: Urine concentration of retinol binding protein (RBP) before the operation in the recipients

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine Concentration of RBP Postoperatively in the Recipients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24hours after the artery unclamping
secondary_outcome.description: Urine concentration of retinol binding protein (RBP) 1hour, 4hours and 24hours after the artery unclamping in the recipients

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of SOD in the Recipients
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of superoxide dismutase (SOD) before the operation, 1hour, 4hours and 24hours after the artery unclamping in the recipients

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of MDA in the Recipients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24hours after the operation
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of malondialdehyde (MDA) before the operation, 1hour, 4hours and 24hours after the artery unclamping in the recipients

arm_group.description: patients (both donors and recipients) had a deflated cuff placed on the left lower limb for 30 min
Donors receive remote ischaemic preconditioning after anaesthesia induction and before surgery started; recipients only have a deflated blood pressure cuff around their leg for 30 minutes.
recipients receive remote ischaemic preconditioning after anaesthesia induction and before surgery started; donors only have a deflated blood pressure cuff around their leg for 30 minutes.

intervention.description: Remote ischaemic preconditioning consisted of three 5-min cycles of left lower limb ischaemia, which was induced by an automated cuff-inflator placed on the left lower limb and inflated to 300 mm Hg, with an intervening 5 min of reperfusion during which the cuff was deflated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject capable of giving written informed consent, with end-stage kidney disease, who is a suitable candidate for primary kidney transplantation
- Living donors
- Compatible ABO blood type
- PRA < 20%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Re-transplant patients
- Those with peripheral vascular disease affecting the lower limbs

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology, Tongji Hospital of Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology

facility.name: Department of Anaesthesiology, Tongji Hospital of Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
responsible_party.investigator_title: M.D. Department of Anaesthesiology, Tongji Hospital of Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients scheduled for living donor renal transplantation in the Department of Transplantation, Tongji Hospital, Huazhong University of Science and Technology were recruited in the project from May 2010 to November 2011.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 68 pairs of patients were enrolled during the recruitment period. among them, 5 recipients had the history of renal transplantation before; 2 recipients had concomitant diabetes mellitus; and another one recipient had severe varicose vein in his lower limb. The left 60 pairs of donors and recipients (120 in total) were finally assigned to groups.

group.title: Control
group.description: patients (both donors and recipients) had a deflated cuff placed on the left lower limb for 30 min

group.title: Donor RIPC
group.description: Donors receive remote ischaemic preconditioning after anaesthesia induction and before surgery started; recipients only have a deflated blood pressure cuff around their leg for 30 minutes.

group.title: Recipient PIPC
group.description: recipients receive remote ischaemic preconditioning after anaesthesia induction and before surgery started; donors only have a deflated blood pressure cuff around their leg for 30 minutes.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The trial was conducted only in our hospital and had a relatively small sample size because of the scarcity of relative living donor renal transplantation compared to other surgeries.

point_of_contact.organization: Department of Anaesthesiology, Tongji Hospital of Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology
